TrnsctnDsc: The Rockefeller University's endowment is an investor in several partnerships where Anthony Evnin (RU Trustee) is General Partner or Member of the General Partner. Anthony Evnin is not and has never been a member of the Rockefeller University Investment Committee, which means that he does not participate in the University's investment decisions. All transactions are conducted at arms length and at FMV.

The Rockefeller University's endowment is an investor in several partnerships where David Sze (RU Trustee) is General Partner or Member of the General Partner. David Sze is not and has never been a member of the Rockefeller University Investment Committee, which means that he does not participate in the University's investment decisions. All transactions are conducted at arms length and at FMV.

Rockefeller University has a busniess relationship with Turner Construction -- which serves as a general contractor for major capital building projects. Ms. Farley's brother-in-law is President and CEO of Turner Construction. Ms. Farley did not participate in the selection of Turner Construction nor has input into its ongoing fees/compensation. Fees paid to Turner construction in FY 2019 is $7.217.367.

RltnshpDscrptnTxt: SECRETARY OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES
TrnsctnDsc: MR. MARK WILLIAMS, A BROKER AT CENTURY 21, LEGACY, AND A DIRECTOR OF THE BOARD OF ANDREW JOHNSON BANK, IS THE SECRETARY OF TUSCULUM COLLEGE'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES. AS A TRUSTEE, HE GAINS ACCESS TO NEW EMPLOYEE HIRES IN ORDER TO APPROACH THEM AS A BROKER AGENT FOR REAL ESTATE SALES AND ACQUISITIONS. THE COLLEGE HAS A BANKING RELATIONSHIP WITH ANDREW JOHNSON BANK.

RltnshpDscrptnTxt: RECIPIENT OF USE OF FACILITIES AND CONTRIBUTOR TO COLLEGE
TrnsctnDsc: NISWONGER FOUNDATION, INC. OPERATES ON THE TUSCULUM COLLEGE CAMPUS AND PROVIDES VARIOUS GRANTS TO THE COLLEGE. TUSCULUM COLLEGE ALLOWS THE FOUNDATION TO OPERATE ON THE COLLEGE FREE OF CHARGE. HOWEVER, THE COLLEGE BILLS THE FOUNDATION FOR ANNUAL CHARGES RELATING TO SOME OF THE STAFF MEMBERS' SALARIES AND OTHER ADMINISTRATIVE EXEPNSES THAT THE COLLEGE PAYS FOR THE FOUNDATION THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. NISWONGER FOUNDATION, INC. IS ALSO A PARTNER OF THE NORTHEAST TENNESSEE COLLEGE AND CAREER READINESS CONSORTIUM.

RltnshpDscrptnTxt: CARTER CO BK MAJORITY OWNER DR. WILLIAM B. GREENE, JR., TRUSTEE OF COLLEGE
TrnsctnAmt: ON DECEMBER 5, 2005, MILLIGAN COLLEGE OBTAINED A $5,500,000 TAX-EXEMPT BOND FROM CARTER COUNTY BANK, A DIVISION OF THE BANK OF TENNESSEE, FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE ELIZABETH LEITNER GREGORY CENTER FOR THE LIBERAL ARTS. FOR THE YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2019, THE BALANCE PAYABLE ON THE BOND WAS $2,910,374. FOR THE YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2019, THE COLLEGE PAID A TOTAL OF $410,844 TO THE BANK - PRINCIPAL OF $279,163 AND INTEREST EXPENSE OF $131,680. ON DECEMBER 7, 2012, MILLIGAN COLLEGE OBTAINED A $7,500,000 TAX-EXEMPT BOND FROM CARTER COUNTY BANK, A DIVISION OF THE BANK OF TENNESSEE, FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE VILLAGE STUDENT RESIDENT HALLS. FOR THE YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2019, THE BALANCE PAYABLE ON THE BOND WAS $5,426,450. FOR THE YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2019, THE COLLEGE PAID A TOTAL OF $470,060 TO THE BANK - PRINCIPAL OF $338,818 AND INTEREST EXPENSE OF $131,242.

RltnshpDscrptnTxt: CARTER CO BK, MAJORITY OWNER DR. WILLIAM B. GREENE, JR., TRUSTEE OF COLLEGE
TrnsctnAmt: ON JULY 1, 2015, AS PART OF THE ACQUISITION OF EMMANUEL CHRISTIAN SEMINARY, THE COLLEGE ASSUMED A NOTE PAYABLE FROM CARTER COUNTY BANK, A DIVISION OF THE BANK OF TENNESSEE, WITH AN OUTSTANDING BALANCE OF 2,313,737, WHICH IS SECURED BY REAL ESTATE. FOR THE YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2019, THE BALANCE PAYABLE ON THE NOTE PAYABLE WAS $1,867,869. FOR THE YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2019, THE COLLEGE PAID A TOTAL OF $164,051 TO THE BANK - PRINCIPAL OF $100,688 AND INTEREST EXPENSE OF $63,363.ON JUNE 15, 2016, MILLIGAN COLLEGE OBTAINED A $3,600,000 NOTE PAYABLE FROM CARTER COUNTY BANK, A DIVISION OF THE BANK OF TENNESSEE, FOR THE ENERGY EFFICIENCY PROJECT, WHICH IS SECURED BY REAL ESTATE. FOR THE YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2019, THE BALANCE PAYABLE ON THE NOTE PAYABLE WAS $3,040,458. FOR THE YEAR ENDED MAY 31, 2019, THE COLLEGE PAID A TOTAL OF $309,910 TO THE BANK - PRINCIPAL OF $198,323 AND INTEREST EXPENSE OF $111,586.
